title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0042

segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erica.
And today with Erica, we're bringing you a great lesson about time.
segments.cn: 今天和Erica一起，我们将为你带来一个关于时间的精彩课程。

segments.en: You need more of it.
We need more time, right?
segments.cn: 我们需要更多时间，对吧？

segments.en: So we're going to be teaching you how you can ask for more time.
segments.cn: 所以我们将教你如何请求更多时间。

segments.en: If you're working on a project at work and you can't finish it on time, you have to ask your boss for more time.
segments.cn: 如果你在工作上做一个项目，无法按时完成，你必须向你的老板请求更多时间。

segments.en: Right.
So today in our dialogue, Casey needs more time to put together a press kit.
segments.cn: 所以今天在我们的对话中，Casey需要更多时间来准备新闻资料包。

segments.en: What's a press kit?
Good question.
A press kit is something the marketing department will put together.
segments.cn: 新闻资料包是市场部准备的东西。

segments.en: Basically pictures, logos, information about the company.
segments.cn: 基本上是图片、标志、公司信息。

segments.en: So when a newspaper or a magazine wants to write an article about them, so they have something already prepared that they could give the newspaper or magazine.
segments.cn: 所以当报纸或杂志想写关于他们的文章时，他们已经准备好可以给报纸或杂志的东西。

segments.en: Okay.
Okay.
So let's listen to our dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 那么我们来第一次听我们的对话。

segments.en: And as always, it's going to be at a normal speed, so it might be a little bit difficult to understand.
segments.cn: 和往常一样，速度会正常，所以可能有点难以理解。

segments.en: We'll come back in one minute and tell you about some of the key language.
segments.cn: 我们会在一分钟后回来，告诉你一些关键语言。

segments.en: So, Casey, how are things going with the photos for the press kit?
segments.cn: 所以，Casey，新闻资料包的照片进展如何？

segments.en: Yeah, I've been meaning to talk to you about that.
segments.cn: 是的，我一直想和你谈谈这个。

segments.en: I might need to ask for an extension on that deadline.
segments.cn: 我可能需要请求延长截止日期。

segments.en: You've had over a month to get this finalized.
segments.cn: 你已经有一个多月的时间来完成这个。

segments.en: Why are things delayed?
Well, the thing is, we ran into a lot of problems.
segments.cn: 嗯，问题是我们遇到了很多麻烦。

segments.en: I'm not looking for excuses here.
I just want to get this finished on time.
segments.cn: 我只是想按时完成这个。

segments.en: I know, and I apologize for the delay, but some things were just beyond my control.
segments.cn: 我知道，我为延迟道歉，但有些事情超出了我的控制。

segments.en: I had trouble booking the photographer, and then Michael was sick for three weeks, so I couldn't include him in the photos.
segments.cn: 我在预定摄影师时遇到麻烦，然后Michael生病了三周，所以我无法把他包括在照片中。

segments.en: And the design team lost all the files, so I had to redo the pictures.
segments.cn: 而且设计团队丢失了所有文件，所以我不得不重新拍照。

segments.en: I'm not going to put this off any longer, Casey.
I want those photos ASAP.
segments.cn: 我想尽快要到那些照片。

segments.en: All right, so Casey is in trouble, I think.
Yeah, I think her boss is pretty upset.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得她的老板很生气。

segments.en: Yeah.
Well, let's take a look at some of the language that we saw in this dialogue in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看在这个对话中看到的一些语言，语言要点。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
First word today is deadline.
segments.cn: 今天的第一个词是截止日期。

segments.en: Deadline.
Deadline.
Deadline.
So, Erica, what's a deadline?
It is the last possible date to do something.
segments.cn: 它是做某事的最后日期。

segments.en: So, for example, when we were in school, our teacher would send us homework and say it was for Friday.
segments.cn: 例如，当我们在学校时，老师会给我们布置作业，并说是星期五。

segments.en: So the deadline was Friday.
segments.cn: 所以截止日期是星期五。

segments.en: Was Friday.
Mm-hmm.
Right?
Or when you're at work, you have projects that you have to finish by a certain date.
segments.cn: 或者当你在工作时，你有项目必须在某个日期之前完成。

segments.en: That's your deadline.
Exactly.
Okay, let's look at our next word.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看下一个词。

segments.en: Extension.
Extension.
Extension.
Extension.
So, extension and deadline go together, right?
segments.cn: 所以，延期和截止日期是一起的，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
If you can't reach your deadline or you can't make your deadline, you must ask for an extension.
segments.cn: 如果你无法达到截止日期，或者无法按时完成，你必须请求延期。

segments.en: An extension.
So you ask for more time.
Yeah, an extension is moving the deadline in the future.
segments.cn: 是的，延期就是将截止日期推迟到未来。

segments.en: All right, interesting.
Let's look at our next word.
Ran into.
Ran into.
Ran into.
Ran into some problems.
So we ran into some problems in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 所以我们在这个对话中遇到了一些问题。

segments.en: Let's listen to some more examples of run into so we can understand the meaning.
segments.cn: 让我们听一些关于遇到的更多例子，以便理解其含义。

segments.en: Example one.
We ran into a storm on our way home.
segments.cn: 我们在回家的路上遇到了一场暴风雨。

segments.en: Example two.
If you're not careful now, you're going to run into a lot of problems later.
segments.cn: 如果你现在不小心，你将来会遇到很多问题。

segments.en: Example three.
I ran into some trouble with my computer.
segments.cn: 我在电脑上遇到了一些麻烦。

segments.en: Okay, good example.
So it's clear now, right?
segments.cn: 所以现在很清楚了，对吧？

segments.en: Right, if you run into problems, you meet some problems.
segments.cn: 对，如果你遇到问题，就是遇到了一些问题。

segments.en: Right, many students say it in that way.
I met some problems.
Yeah, but that's wrong.
Right, so you would say I ran into some problems.
segments.cn: 对，所以你应该说我遇到了一些问题。

segments.en: Right, I met some problems is wrong, wrong, wrong.
segments.cn: 对，我遇到了一些问题是错的，错的，错的。

segments.en: Okay, don't say met some problems.
segments.cn: 好的，不要说遇到一些问题。

segments.en: I ran into some problems.
I ran into, okay.
And our last word for language take away.
segments.cn: 我们的最后一个语言要点。

segments.en: Delayed.
Delayed.
Delayed.
Delayed.
So when something is delayed, it's... Late.
segments.cn: 所以当某事被延迟时，它是... 晚的。

segments.en: Late.
And the opposite is... On time.
Yeah, so your flight was delayed.
segments.cn: 是的，所以你的航班被延迟了。

segments.en: Or your flight was on time.
The project was delayed.
Or your project was on time.
segments.cn: 或者你的项目是准时的。

segments.en: Clear.
Alright, so now let's go back to the dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们回到对话。

segments.en: Let's listen to it again.
And this time it will be a little bit slower so you can understand some of these phrases we just talked about.
segments.cn: 这次会慢一点，这样你可以理解我们刚才谈到的一些短语。

segments.en: So, Casey, how are things going with the photos for the press kit?
segments.cn: 所以，Casey，新闻资料包的照片进展如何？

segments.en: Yeah, I've been meaning to talk to you about that.
segments.cn: 是的，我一直想和你谈谈这个。

segments.en: I might need to ask for an extension on that deadline.
segments.cn: 我可能需要请求延长截止日期。

segments.en: You've had over a month to get this finalized.
segments.cn: 你已经有一个多月的时间来完成这个。

segments.en: Why are things delayed?
Well, the thing is, we ran into a lot of problems.
segments.cn: 嗯，问题是我们遇到了很多麻烦。

segments.en: I'm not finished on time.
I know.
And I apologize for the delay.
But some things were just beyond my control.
segments.cn: 但有些事情超出了我的控制。

segments.en: I had trouble booking the photographer.
segments.cn: 我在预定摄影师时遇到麻烦。

segments.en: And then Michael was sick for three weeks so I couldn't include him in the photos.
segments.cn: 然后Michael病了三周，所以我无法把他包括在照片中。

segments.en: And the design team lost all the files so I had to redo the pictures.
segments.cn: 设计团队丢失了所有文件，所以我不得不重新拍照。

segments.en: I'm not going to put this off any longer, Casey.
I want those photos ASAP.
Okay, so there were some really useful phrases that we saw in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，我们在这个对话中看到了一些非常有用的短语。

segments.en: Yeah, some wonderful phrases that you can use when you want to ask for more time.
segments.cn: 是的，有一些很棒的短语可以用来请求更多时间。

segments.en: Okay, so let's look at these phrases in fluency builder.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们在流利度构建器中看看这些短语。

segments.en: All right, what's our first phrase?
segments.cn: 好的，我们的第一个短语是什么？

segments.en: I've been meaning to talk to you.
I've been meaning to.
I've been meaning to.
Okay, we have some really great examples of how you can combine I've been meaning to with different verbs.
segments.cn: 好的，我们有一些很好的例子，展示了如何将“我一直想”与不同的动词结合。

segments.en: Yeah, let's listen.
Example one.
I'm sorry I haven't called you yet.
segments.cn: 对不起，我还没给你打电话。

segments.en: I've been meaning to but I've been busy.
segments.cn: 我一直想打，但我一直很忙。

segments.en: Example two.
I've been meaning to tell you but John quit yesterday.
segments.cn: 我一直想告诉你，但John昨天辞职了。

segments.en: Example three.
I've been meaning to see that film for a while.
I've been meaning to go to that restaurant but I haven't had time.
segments.cn: 我一直想去那家餐厅，但我没有时间。

segments.en: So you've been wanting to for a long time.
I've been thinking about it.
I've been planning to do it.
But you just haven't done it.
I haven't done it maybe because I haven't had time or money.
segments.cn: 我没有去做，可能是因为我没有时间或钱。

segments.en: Okay, good phrase.
Our next phrase is beyond my control.
segments.cn: 我们下一个短语是超出我的控制。

segments.en: Beyond my control.
It's beyond my control.
So it means that I can't control it.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着我无法控制它。

segments.en: You can't do anything about it.
Can't do anything about it.
The weather is beyond my control.
Right, or relate with this project because Jane was sick for one month.
segments.cn: 对，或者与这个项目有关，因为Jane病了一个月。

segments.en: It was beyond my control.
Okay, it wasn't your fault.
No.
Okay, and our last phrase for fluency builder put this off.
segments.cn: 好的，我们流利度构建器的最后一个短语是拖延。

segments.en: Put this off.
Put this off.
Put this off.
So let's listen to some more examples of put this off before we explain the meaning.
segments.cn: 所以在我们解释含义之前，让我们听一些关于拖延的更多例子。

segments.en: Example one.
I've been putting off this project for a week and it's due tomorrow.
segments.cn: 我已经拖延这个项目一周了，明天到期。

segments.en: Example two.
Can we put off our meeting until next week?
segments.cn: 我们可以把会议推迟到下周吗？

segments.en: I'm too busy right now.
Example three.
I've been putting off my email all day and now I have 50 messages to respond to.
segments.cn: 我整天都在拖延我的电子邮件，现在我有50条消息要回复。

segments.en: So Marco, when you put something off, you... Leave it for later.
segments.cn: 所以Marco，当你拖延某事时，你……把它留到以后。

segments.en: Okay.
Right, so maybe I have to write a report today.
segments.cn: 对，所以也许我今天必须写一份报告。

segments.en: Mm-hmm.
But I'm gonna put it off till tomorrow.
So you're gonna do it tomorrow.
I'll do it tomorrow.
Okay, so we've seen some really great words and some really good phrases, so now let's listen to our dialogue for the last time and then we'll come back and talk some more.
segments.cn: 好的，我们看到了一些很好的单词和短语，现在让我们最后一次听我们的对话，然后我们再回来聊聊。

segments.en: So, Casey, how are things going with the photos for the press kit?
segments.cn: 所以，Casey，新闻资料包的照片进展如何？

segments.en: Yeah, I've been meaning to talk to you about that.
segments.cn: 是的，我一直想和你谈谈这个。

segments.en: I might need to ask for an extension on that deadline.
segments.cn: 我可能需要请求延长截止日期。

segments.en: You've had over a month to get this finalized.
segments.cn: 你已经有一个多月的时间来完成这个。

segments.en: Why are things delayed?
Well, the thing is we ran into a lot of problems.
segments.cn: 嗯，问题是我们遇到了很多麻烦。

segments.en: I'm not looking for excuses here.
I just want to get this finished on time.
I know, and I apologize for the delay, but some things were just beyond my control.
segments.cn: 我知道，我为延误道歉，但有些事情超出了我的控制。

segments.en: I had trouble booking the photographer and then Michael was sick for three weeks, so I couldn't include him in the photos.
segments.cn: 我在预定摄影师时遇到麻烦，然后Michael病了三周，所以我无法把他包括在照片中。

segments.en: And the design team lost all the files, so I had to redo the pictures.
segments.cn: 设计团队丢失了所有文件，所以我不得不重新拍照。

segments.en: I'm not going to put this off any longer, Casey.
I want those photos ASAP.
Well, Marco, do you think that Casey's reasons for being late are good?
segments.cn: 好吧，Marco，你认为Casey迟到的理由好吗？

segments.en: I think so, because it wasn't really her fault, the whole situation with the photographer, and then one of her co-workers was sick for three weeks.
segments.cn: 我认为是的，因为这并不完全是她的错，摄影师的整个情况，然后她的一位同事病了三周。

segments.en: It's not really her fault, right?
segments.cn: 这并不完全是她的错，对吧？

segments.en: Right, but maybe the boss thinks that she's making excuses.
segments.cn: 对，但也许老板认为她在找借口。

segments.en: Yeah, maybe she's making excuses.
That's really common.
Like, for example, when we were kids, you would say, oh, you know, my dog ate my homework.
segments.cn: 比如，当我们还是孩子的时候，你会说，哦，你知道，我的狗吃了我的作业。

segments.en: Right, but that really happened to me once.
segments.cn: 对，但这真的发生在我身上。

segments.en: Your dog ate your homework?
My cat ate my homework.
Your cat ate your homework?
Yeah.
And what did your teacher say?
Well, actually, I was a really good student, so my teacher believed me.
segments.cn: 嗯，实际上，我是个很好的学生，所以老师相信我。

segments.en: Well, my teacher wouldn't have believed me.
segments.cn: 嗯，我的老师不会相信我。

segments.en: Really?
No, no, she would have called my parents, most likely.
segments.cn: 不，不，她很可能会叫我的父母。

segments.en: Well, my cat really did eat my homework, and I just left it on the table, and it chewed it all up.
segments.cn: 嗯，我的猫真的吃了我的作业，我只是把它放在桌子上，它把它咬坏了。

segments.en: That's weird.
Why would your cat do that?
segments.cn: 你的猫为什么要这样做？

segments.en: I don't know.
A lot of weird excuses out there.
segments.cn: 外面有很多奇怪的借口。

segments.en: I was abducted by aliens.
My mom accidentally mailed my homework to Africa.
segments.cn: 我妈妈不小心把我的作业寄到了非洲。

segments.en: Really?
This happened to you?
Creative writing.
Creative excuses.
Well, I want to hear from our listeners.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想听听我们的听众。

segments.en: I want to know what excuses they've used for being late with something.
segments.cn: 我想知道他们用什么借口来解释迟到。

segments.en: So send us your excuses, send us your comments and questions, go to our website at EnglishPod.com, where Eric and I are always there to answer your questions.
segments.cn: 所以把你的借口发给我们，发送你的评论和问题，访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com，埃里克和我总是在那里回答你的问题。

segments.en: That's right, Marco, and this is an elementary lesson, right?
segments.cn: 没错，马尔科，这是一个初级课程，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly.
But we also have intermediate and upper intermediate and advanced lessons for you more fluent English speakers.
segments.cn: 但我们也有中级、高中级和高级课程，适合更流利的英语学习者。

segments.en: Exactly, so if you're listening to us on iTunes, be sure to visit our website and come see what else we have to offer.
segments.cn: 没错，所以如果你在 iTunes 上收听我们，一定要访问我们的网站，看看我们还有什么其他内容。

segments.en: Well, I think we're out of time, but until next time, it's goodbye!
segments.cn: 嗯，我想我们没时间了，但下次见，再见！
